nme.Assets

type
class

The Assets class provides a cross-platform interface to access embedded images, fonts, sounds and other resource files.

The contents are populated automatically when an application is compiled using the NME command-line tools, based on the contents of the *.nmml project file.

For most platforms, the assets are included in the same directory or package as the application, and the paths are handled automatically. For web content, the assets are preloaded before the start of the rest of the application. You can customize the preloader by extending the NMEPreloader class, and specifying a custom preloader using in the project file.

Static Variables

cachedBitmapData : Hash<nme.display.BitmapData>

Static Methods

getBitmapData(id : String, ?useCache : Bool) : nme.display.BitmapData

parameters
id The ID or asset path for the bitmap
useCache (Optional) Whether to use BitmapData from the cache (Default: true)
returns
A new BItmapData object
Gets an instance of an embedded bitmap

getBytes(id : String) : nme.utils.ByteArray

parameters
id The ID or asset path for the file
returns
A new ByteArray object
Gets an instance of an embedded binary asset

getFont(id : String) : nme.text.Font

parameters
id The ID or asset path for the font
returns
A new Font object
Gets an instance of an embedded font

getMovieClip(id : String) : format.display.MovieClip

parameters
id The library and ID for the MovieClip
returns
A new Sound object
Gets an instance of a library MovieClip

getSound(id : String) : nme.media.Sound

parameters
id The ID or asset path for the sound
returns
A new Sound object
Gets an instance of an embedded sound

getText(id : String) : String

parameters
id The ID or asset path for the file
returns
A new String object
Gets an instance of an embedded text asset
